programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at the events that led to the catastrophic blow-out that tore through Aloha Airlines Flight 243 en route to Hawaii.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The fish in the swamp start dying in large numbers, providing plenty of food for the alligators - which means the hunters' bait is now useless and new methods are needed.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: With the Knight Templar's Paris Temple under siege, De Nogaret seeks to sow doubt in the King's mind. Queen Joan must consider what is best for Navarre. Part-fictionalised drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Landry seeks the help of Jacques de Molay, the Temple Grand Master, while Queen Joan plots her escape. Drama, starring Tom Cullen.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Vastly outnumbered, the Templars must fight for their lives in a battle with the Red Knights. Tom Cullen stars.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle is set a stiff challenge, and Mike is desperate to buy a 1967 Ford Fairlane car.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets excited over a jar of powdered gold as he believes it is worth a lot of money, and an explosive acid test is poised to reveal all.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer calls in their lawyer to settle a row over a fake receipt, but Les has a trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into the possibility that insects have descended from, and could have links to, extraterrestrials which landed on Earth thousands of years ago.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos heads to Peru to investigate whether the strange symbols covering its desert floor are key to proving aliens once visited Earth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The big money buyers find themselves out of their comfort zones in DeSoto, and a new face from across the pond threatens to ruin Ricky and Bubba's day.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas hoping to land a locker of a lifetime, and Mary flouts the law in her eagerness to score a dream unit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley challenges Seth to a unique competition in the shop, and should he lose, the one thing he has been trying to keep a secret will be revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les loses his temper when the kids suggest he should sell their failing second store, while Seth decides to put a sneaky plan into action.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys try to make a deal over a valuable teddy bear, a 19th-century pistol and a Second World War gas mask.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered antique photographs of outlaw Jesse James, and an amplifier for a 1950s organ.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: For a Good Time, Call Ivy
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi are under financial pressure, and fear they will lose one of their shops if they do not make a profitable bid soon.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have to break some bad news to the staff of one of their stores, while Rene tries to dominate his rivals.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car in a unit auction in Covina, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a whack-a-mole arcade game and a water cannon, after fighting it out at a Brooklyn storage auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: Air Emergency
programme.desc: Pressure on pilots has never been higher. But a sudden lack of concentration, a miscalculation or a wrong command can end in disaster. We examine the science and see the results of just what can happen when the pilot gets it wrong..

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists ask whether a currently unidentified species represented in human DNA could be a result of breeding between man and alien in the distant past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth's plan to sell the Pontiac shop hits a snag and Ashley is pulled into the fray, and a meeting with a potential buyer leaves them facing a life-changing situation.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les struggles to forgive Seth for trying to sell his business and decides to lock himself in the office. Meanwhile, a fight breaks out on the shop floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les faces a dilemma over the authenticity of a rare guitar and, with no expert on hand for advice, he is forced to go with his gut instinct.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley reacts to some bad manners in the shop queue, a kooky cowboy arrives at the counter and Rich makes an error that could cost him his job.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: After facing a hostile reception at an auction in New Jersey, Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1960s skeet-throwing machine and an antique carriage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet, as well as a bowling pin-setter, at an auction in California and hope to strike a deal that will result in a profit.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must create signature slasher blades, each using a different type of metal. The two finalists return to their home forges to re-create the Grim Reaper's scythe, a signature slasher blade that would give Freddy Krueger nightmares.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: The bladesmiths of Baltimore Knife and Sword forge a pair of exotic weapons of ancient Japan. Danny Trejo and his team conjure up amazing experiments to test the deadly and diabolical blades.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the King of Montebello
programme.desc: Ivy hires someone to look after his shop, while Jarrod and Brandi split up for auctions in Montebello.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car in a unit auction in Covina, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a whack-a-mole arcade game and a water cannon, after fighting it out at a Brooklyn storage auction.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer tries desperately to earn a commission and qualify for transfer from Red Dwarf to an advanced holoship containing the cream of the Space Corps, and a woman he has developed feelings for. Starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A mechanical life form named the Inquisitor's quest to eliminate worthless beings brings him aboard Red Dwarf, where he has plenty of candidates to choose from. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An alternative USA where technology is banned spells trouble for Rimmer and Kryten, and the Dwarfers infiltrate the tech-savvy underground to try to bring down the regime. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels down the west of Scotland, through the mountainous terrain of Arran toward the English border at Gretna. En route they pass Prestwick Airport, the impressive mudflats of Solway Firth, and the Ardeer dunes, where 19th-century inventor Alfred Nobel built what was then the world's largest explosives factory. Neil Oliver presents.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels along the 100-mile stretch of coast between Holyhead and Liverpool. Miranda Krestovnikoff searches for one of the longest-living creatures on the planet in the Menai Straits, while Alice Roberts discovers how a young survivor of a shipwreck helped to found modern orthopaedic surgery. Nick Crane investigates beach pebbles, and Neil Oliver looks around a mysterious cave on the Great Orme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. On the way, Miranda Krestovnikoff visits the only beach race in Europe run under Jockey Club rules at Laytown Races and Alice Roberts finds herself sent to the Irish salt mines. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Examining the 1966 murders of three police officers in Shepherd's Bush that led to a huge manhunt and calls for the death penalty to be reinstated.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: As Hitler's ambitions spread beyond Germany, the world drew toward another great war. This one would be fought on many battlefields, but also for the hearts and minds of the people.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How the UFO famously sighted at Roswell may have been an experimental aircraft developed by the Nazis during the Second World War. Plus, theories about Glenn Miller's disappearance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part two of two. A massive police search leads to the body of a missing five-year-old, the victim of sexual assault and strangulation. All the evidence points to a local drunkard being the guilty party _ but as the case goes to trial it becomes clear that the outcome is by no means assured. Gripping crime drama by Lynda La Plante, starring David Hayman, Kate Buffery, Helen McCrory and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: An old flame from Northern Ireland turns up on Sergeant McLeod's doorstep with his six-year-old son in tow - a development his wife is not too pleased about. Jeremy has an embarrassing date with Melanie, and soon realises he has more in common with her mother - but she is married to his commanding officer.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: As the regiment prepares to leave for the South Atlantic to defend Deliverance Island, Andy contemplates proposing, and Sarah and Jeremy's relationship begins to crumble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dan Casper has a humiliating run-in with three yobs and later tries to save face by telling Amber they threatened him with a knife. On a less harrowing note, he also enjoys a romantic encounter with new Drugs Referral Officer Rochelle Barratt. Meanwhile, Honey finally confronts Scott, who breaks down and admits to killing his previous wife Karen. Understandably shocked by his confession, she implores him to turn himself in - but when the police arrive at their house, neither husband nor wife is anywhere to be seen.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess returns to work, and suspects a boy she's treating is being abused by his stepmother, while Jac urges Ric to give her a permanent position at Holby. Mark challenges Diane over Frank's DNA test, and when the truth is confirmed, he takes his frustration out on Chrissie. However, when they reconcile over a drink, he considers telling her the truth. Lynda Bellingham and Kym Marsh guest star.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sam questions his future at the hospital during his recovery from the attack, while bed manager Adam wonders whether he should return to nursing, and a management training team courts disaster while competing on an assault course. Starring Derek Thompson and Jonathan Kerrigan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aidan decides to leave Albert Square, Pauline's new found friend causes issues for Arthur and love is in the air when Clyde meets an old family friend.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aidan makes preparations to leave Albert Square, with Mandy in hot pursuit and Pauline's late nights are taking their toll on Arthur.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: An unexploded bomb is discovered next door to Blackwall, which sparks a series of events for the Black Watch, culminating in a fatal fire.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie makes a disturbing discovery about Hector while ploughing her way through Glenbogle's accounts. Archie has trouble adjusting to life without Golly, but when a mystery man rescues a youngster lost in the wildlife park, he and Duncan realise fate has given them a vital clue to the gamekeeper's whereabouts.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna attacks a faith healer's controversial methods, especially when a youngster with arthritis refuses conventional treatment, and Simon comes under increasing pressure from a hotshot Canadian businessman who makes a shocking takeover bid for his company. Meanwhile, Beth moves in with Vic and Lucy, and Henry gets the sympathy vote from Jess _ but will she find out he's been faking his symptoms?.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian struggles with celebrity as Jack and Leonora's relationship blooms. Grandad, meanwhile, gets a reminder from the past.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The new controller wreaks havoc at Maplins as he sets about firing numerous members of staff, and upsets Peggy in the process. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but tries to pretend everything is fine when her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen pay a visit. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The Trio go on a field trip to a historical home, but end up baby-sitting for relatives of Compo.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The coppers search for the killer of docusoap star Efrona Davis, whose body has been found washed ashore. It soon emerges that she received a knock to the head before entering the water, and the list of suspects includes her father, Wayland Bay's resident comedian Rowan Priestley and Gavin Oldham, a man she arranged a date with on the night she died. The investigation takes a surprising turn when a second body is found on the beach. Ricky Tomlinson and John McArdle guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A recent rape is linked to two similar attacks at a chocolate factory 10 years previously, leaving the team with no choice but to reopen all three cases. The detectives uncover news not only of an unhappy workforce, but also of an alleged suicide, and their investigation becomes even more complicated when they discover a severed finger was found in one of the company's snacks. After a visit to the doctor, Gerry decides to quit smoking, and instead of resorting to nicotine patches or gum, he enlists Sandra to help him quit.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team reinvestigates the work of serial killer James Jenson when the wallets of his victims surface on the day he is released from a secure psychiatric unit. However, after turning the spotlight on a second suspect, Dr Bruno Rivelli, and the children's home he previously ran, they find themselves with another murder case on their hands.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer follows the Frankland River into the heart of the 65 million-year-old Walpole Forest - 200 square kilometres of wooded wilderness in Western Australia that provides food and shelter for Aboriginal people. Ray learns that the river was once used by loggers to transport jarrah wood, which is so hard it was used as cobbles for London streets in Victorian times. In the forest, the adventurer lies in wait for the elusive quokka, a small and shy marsupial, and meets environmentalist Prue Anderson, who shows him some of the other forest creatures that she's captured on her hidden camera.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary journey around the UK, with fellow chef and friend Galton Blackiston joining him as he begins in the Isles of Scilly. The pair don diving suits to swim with seals and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Now reunited with Katy, Laura takes drastic measures to hold the person framing her to account in a last-ditch bid for her freedom. But first, she must discover his identity and where he's hiding. To achieve what she needs to prove her innocence, she is forced to collude with the most surprising of people and the shocking truth of what happened on the morning Andrew died is finally revealed. Conclusion of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Keane & Vieira - Best of Enemies
programme.desc: The on-field rivalry between midfielders Roy Keane and Patrick Vieira during their time at Manchester United and Arsenal respectively, when they strived for dominance in a golden period for the clubs. There was no love lost between the two combative players, who captained their teams and enjoyed many memorable battles in the quest for Premier League glory. In this programme, Gabriel Clarke interviews both men.

programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: In the final episode, experts recreate Houdini's buried alive escape stunt, and investigate if he was killed by more sinister forces.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the spiral markings spotted by satellite in the remote African desert, and a weird deadly black blob threatening the Florida Keys.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a custom bike for the Iraq Star Foundation, and Hollywood stars including Jon Voight, Kristy Swanson and Gary Sinise turn out to support the cause.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Turbulence could spell disaster for Mike Kennedy, and a second crack at a $3million Citation V offers Ken Cage and Danny Thompson a shot at redemption.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins a crew of high-rise window washers and hopes to control his fear while sitting on a small seat 400ft above street level.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, featuring how three-wheel electric bikes are manufactured and skin cream is made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, featuring how Wild West holsters are manufactured and water video housings are made.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire, that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Phil and Sig's experiment in trading their junior deckhands comes to a close in the third week of hunting king crab.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Rough conditions on the Bering Sea take their toll, and while Shawn makes the most of his excavator skills, one diver realises he does not have enough money to continue dredging.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini races his 1958 Tojeiro Climax in the Hershey Grand Ascent and the VSCCA Vintage Fall Finale at Lime Rock Park.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a 1941 Lincoln, a 1929 Pierce-Arrow and a Panhard to auction and bids on a Rolls Royce Phantom 3 for a client.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his client's rare 1908 Simplex Speedcar roadster to an auction to see what kind of money it will make.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini restores an AC Ace for a man who has bought it as a surprise for his father.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage Hunters' Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland embark on an epic motoring mission as the pair scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars. The duo spot a classic Golf GTI at a film props company and, at a barn in Suffolk, Drew unearths an early 1970s Lotus Elan that needs radical restoration.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and his friend Sam Lovegrove, the 'Engine Whisperer', take a trip from Cornwall to Oxfordshire to rummage around in some of Britain's most amazing sheds in search of a nice little earner.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove meet Phil in sunny Buckinghamshire, where they find stationary engines, traction engines and vintage petrol cans - but is there anything for the boys to restore and flog?.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is tasked with creating a display based on the French Resistance - a parachute basket filled with items the RAF would have dropped to the Resistance during the Second World War.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Macclesfield, Cheshire, Drew Pritchard meets a mother-and-son team. Later, in Leeds he catches up with a young dealer with an eye for modern pieces.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers behind Drew Pritchard's antiques empire save an iconic Eames lounge chair. They also revive an unusual 90-year old oil lamp and a glamourous steam trunk.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down the first-ever Bond car, a 1963 Sunbeam Alpine. He finds a rust-free, race-ready motor, but Edd China discovers some surprises in the engine bay.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien assess sewing machines in Kent as they continue their journey across the UK to find unique and valuable items 'lost' in people's homes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard head to a motorbike museum on the Isle of Man, where he hopes its unique history will mean a truckload of rare finds.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats are under extra pressure as rival miners close in on their claim. Plus, the Bushmen must brave an abandoned mine to remove a dead animal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rookie skippers Jake Anderson and Josh Harris struggle as a 600 mile wide arctic storm continues to ravage the fleet.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a set of jaws are forged, capable of chomping through concrete and demolish tower blocks. Plus, the ways an historic airman's bomber jacket can be stiched, and the means of brewing the oldest beer in the Western world.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How platinum cleans exhaust fumes, and the technology that enabled the construction of a space station 360km above Earth.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a serial arsonist in Washington, DC. The perpetrator was a careful operator, but there were clues in the ashes that led forensic scientists to the culprit.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2015 care worker Torrance Cheeves is found stabbed to death in his Texas home. With no suspects and a trail of puzzling evidence, officers turned to CCTV footage for clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a determined FBI agent brought about the conviction of John Gotti, the homicidal head of the Gambino crime family in New York.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a young foal with a dislocated knee, after which every second counts as the team executes a seizure warrant and rushes it back.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Harriet, a bearded dragon with a strange lump on its leg, as he continues to work at Kyabram Vet Clinic in Victoria.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole and her vocal family visit the store, while Amanda's mother refuses to leave until her daughter's dress is fixed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: That's How You Dress a Lady
programme.desc: Randy's runway show finally arrives - his big opportunity to show he's back as a designer for good. Plus, bride Jaqueline is at odds with her mother.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown takes on his most frightening mission ever, rescuing a trapped snake. He also helps an endangered turtle and has a shocking discovery with puppy Tyson.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown tends to Honey the dog, who has jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat. Plus, Tasmanian devils fight a mysterious illness, and a koala losing its sight.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Investigators follow up reports of a starving dog in a Brooklyn basement, but when the animal is released the owner flees.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Investigators Hairston and Dowe remove animals including a pig from the home of a hoarder they have previously encountered.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A man risks everything in the hunt for his sister's killer, and a sexual predator is getting away with his crimes.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 36-year-old Air Force veteran Michael VanZandt. When he vanished in March 2016, California police suspected a random attacker, but his relatives were haunted by his thrill-seeking when considering his fate.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of John Glasgow, an Arkansas chief financial officer whose car was found abandoned in a state park a day after he left his Little Rock home for work in 2008. It was later claimed he had been killed by disreputable creditors, but this has never been proved.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Southern bride Shaina expected shopping for an outfit to be easy - until her mother and brother start arguing over dress styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Hannah wants a wedding gown to match the style of her icon Grace Kelly, but the bride-to-be's sister prefers something modern and sexy.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Chato invites the Atlanta Falcons cheerleaders to help her choose a dress, but the squad is far from united when it comes to knowing what looks best.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country music star Angaleena Presley struggles to make her voice heard as she shops for a wedding dress with her bandmates.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Between a Sham-Rock and a Hard Place
programme.desc: A bride's mum and mother-in-law have conflicting opinions over her shoulder tattoo, but hopefully the family will find it easier to agree on the wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Jessica could end up leaving empty-handed when her demands have the staff running in circles, while Monique breaks shop rules by asking her fiance to make the final decision.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Helen is anxious about choosing the right gown, and Jo and Alison manage a last-minute refit for bride Aimee.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Janine hopes to find a gown with a wow factor, and newly pregnant Jacqui worries that her chosen dress cannot accommodate a baby bump.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals with a love of all things vintage are given 800 euros to spend at a French market in the hope of upcycling their goods and making a profit. Dealer Mark Franks helps Jemma, Kellie and David as they shop in Durtal, north-west France, where items on offer include a child's desk and a leather chair.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou's manoeuvring skills are put to the test as he drives a client's 40ft motorhome, and the Prestige Pawnbrokers boss also jets off to Marbella, Spain, with gem expert Kristen to value some precious jewellery. A self-confessed shopaholic hopes to sell two modern art paintings to pursue a new career in photography, while a woman decides to get rid of some of her designer handbags to raise cash for her hair extensions business.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part one of two. Updates on Laura and Chay's progress, with Laura scared about skin removal and Chay trying to maintain her weight loss having announced she is transgender.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns agree to let two anthropology students move into their house. They will get an unfiltered look at the family's polygamist lifestyle.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride Laura made some drastic alterations to her dress and now it is a mess. Former basketball Paralympian Zoe needs a dress that is both beautiful and suitable.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Kayleigh has already bought three black dresses online but none makes her feel like a bride. Plus, Tina and Tiff have some strict instructions for Jo and Al.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Investigation into the murder of a mother and her learning disabled son, whose trust fund of $1.7million turned the father into the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a seemingly young and healthy woman is found dead in her Wisconsin bathroom, forensic officers assist detectives in determining whether she committed suicide or was unlawfully killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic officers assist police to discover whether the deaths of three individuals on separate continents were caused by the same killer.
